text: Dmytro Kuleba () (born on April 19, 1981 in Sumy, Ukraine) is the Vice Prime Minister of Ukraine for European and Euro-Atlantic Integration of Ukraine since August 29, 2019.Parliament approves new Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine Government Portal He had been the Permanent Representative of Ukraine to the Council of Europe between 2016 and 2019. == Biography == He has been working in the field of Ministry of Foreign Affairs since 2003. In 2013, he left the civil service to head the UART Foundation for Cultural Diplomacy. In December 2017 Dmytro Kuleba was named the best Ukrainian ambassador of the Year 2017 by the Institute of World Policy. Інститут світової політики назвав топ-послів 2017 року Kuleba's wife Yevhenia is the number 1 on the party list for the Kyiv City Council of the party Servant of the People in the 2020 Kyiv local election set for 25 October 2020. Yevhenia Kuleba headed the list of "Servants of the People" in the Kyiv City Council elections, Ukrayinska Pravda (20 September 2020)Rada appoints next elections to local self-govt bodies for Oct 25, Interfax-Ukraine (15 July 2020) == See also == * Honcharuk Government * Shmyhal Government * List of foreign ministers in 2020 * List of current foreign ministers == References == ==External links== * * * Honcharuk’s government: who joined the Cabinet of Ministers? * Meet the Ministers: What We Know About Ukraine’s New Cabinet, Hromadske.TV Category:Diplomats from Kyiv Category:Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv, Institute of International Relations alumni Category:1981 births Category:Living people Category:Vice Prime Ministers of Ukraine Category:People from Sumy Category:21st-century diplomats Category:Servant of the People (political party) politicians Category:Foreign ministers of Ukraine Category:European integration ministers of Ukraine Category:Permanent Representatives of Ukraine to the Council of Europe Category:National Security and Defense Council of Ukraine
title: Dmytro Kuleba
